	With respect to Chembio's DPP&#174; Leptospirosis test, Bio-Manguinhos had not qualified to request the technology transfer.&#160; Bio-Manguinhos made purchases of $135,000 of this product in 2011, and it made -0- purchases in 2012, $45,000 in 2013 and it made -0- purchases in 2014 and -0- in 2015.&#160; In order to qualify for the technology transfer, Bio-Manguinhos would need to purchase an additional $225,000 of this product.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="5152FBB1B4FD4E1289042EC61DCEBABE" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As stated above, Bio-Manguinhos is not obligated to make any purchases.&#160; After the specified level of sales for a particular product has been achieved, FIOCRUZ may request that the technology for that product be transferred to FIOCRUZ together with an exclusive license to produce and sell that product in a defined territory.&#160; The license is to provide that Chembio will receive a royalty on all sales.&#160; Chembio does not release the amount of this royalty because it could have an adverse effect on negotiations concerning royalties in potential transactions with other parties.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="EF7261D2C95F4813AA888A45B324E079" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	All the agreements expire five years after the date of the technology transfer.&#160; If terminated earlier by default of FIOCRUZ, FIOCRUZ must stop all activity; if terminated earlier by default of Chembio, or if terminated by natural expiry, FIOCRUZ can continue to produce and commercialize the product without paying royalties.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Other OEM And License Agreements Related to DPP&#174; Technology
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	In addition to our agreements with FIOCRUZ, we have entered into certain OEM and license agreements with other parties with respect to certain products that we have developed based on our DPP&#174; technology.&#160; In 2008 we entered into a product development and license agreement with Bio-Rad Laboratories, Inc. (Bio-Rad), a leading multinational life sciences company, for the first ever POC test for the confirmation of HIV (reflex test used after initial screening test(s) are positive).&#160; This product utilizes our DPP&#174; technology, capitalizing on its multiplexing advantages, and is much simpler to perform than the legacy confirmatory platform, known as western blot, which requires a substantial amount of technical training and hands-on time and which is more expensive to manufacture and distribute.&#160; This product was CE marked and was launched by Bio-Rad in the second quarter of 2013 in Europe under their Geenius&#174; brand; and an FDA PMA approval was received in 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	In 2013 we entered into collaboration with Labtest, a private company in Brazil, for the distribution of a number of products in Brazil that would be co-branded with Labtest and Chembio trademarks.&#160; Under this agreement, upon request from Labtest, for which there is no requirement, Chembio will sell the appropriate DPP&#174; components to Labtest for further manufacture and assembly in Brazil.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	In February 2014, Chembio entered into a technology transfer and license agreement with RVR Diagnostics SDN BHD ("RVR"), a privately-held company in Malaysia. The agreement supports Chembio's strategy of establishing a market presence in Asia, in collaboration with RVR as a licensee, distributor, and contract manufacturer, depending on the circumstances. The agreements grant exclusive distribution rights to RVR in certain countries in the region and enable RVR to manufacture Chembio's DPP&#174; HIV 1/2 Assay and DPP&#174; HIV-Syphilis Assay, and potentially other products developed by Chembio, such as Dengue,&#160;incorporating its patented DPP&#174; technology as indicated in the DPP&#174; Technology &amp; Development section above.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Our Rapid Test Technologies
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	All of our commercially available current products employ either in-licensed lateral flow technology or our own patented Dual Path Platform (DPP&#174;) technology. Both lateral flow technology and DPP&#174; allow the development of accurate, low cost, easy-to-perform, single-use diagnostic tests for rapid, visual detection of specific antigen-antibody complexes on a test strip.&#160; These formats provide a test that is simple (requires neither electricity nor expensive equipment for test execution or reading, nor skilled personnel for test interpretation), rapid (turnaround time approximately 15 minutes), safe (minimizes handling of potentially infected specimens), non-invasive (requires 5-20 micro liters of whole blood easily obtained with a finger prick, or alternatively, serum or plasma), stable (24 months at room temperature storage in the case of our HIV tests), and highly reproducible.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;We believe that products developed using DPP&#174; technology can provide superior diagnostic performance as compared with products that use lateral flow technology.&#160; The reason for this is that one of the major differences between the two platforms is that in DPP&#174; samples are allowed to incubate with the target analyte in the test zone before introduction of the labeling reagent/conjugate, whereas in lateral flow, samples are combined with the labeling reagent to form a complex before coming in contact with the target analyte.&#160; We believe that this complex can compromise test performance.&#160; Also, because of the usage in DPP&#174; of a separately connected sample strip, the control and delivery of sample material is substantially improved.&#160; This feature is critical in the development of multiplex tests, as well as tests that involve viscous sample material (such as oral fluid) that can be impeded when forced to combine with labeling reagents before migration on the test strip to the test zone area.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Multiplexing is significantly improved as a result of the design of DPP&#174; and this provides a significant advantage.&#160; For example, the HIV confirmatory test we developed for Bio-Rad that is described above employs six different markers related to various epitopes of the HIV antigen.&#160; We have a number of other products in development, including those being developed in sponsored development programs that involve the use of multiple (e.g. eight) test bands. Although all of these products could be visually read, we can also use handheld and desktop readers with our DPP&#174; products to objectively measure, quantify, record and report DPP&#174; test results.&#160; Certain of the products we have and/or are developing incorporate some of these readers, and we are developing other products that may be used with or will require use of a reader.&#160; Also, platforms can incorporate labeling reagents that cannot be visually read except by employing a reader, such as fluorescence, though no products are currently utilizing such reagents.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;&#160;We are pursuing additional capabilities and technologies that will complement our current product portfolio and business strategy.&#160; This activity includes pursing development, license or acquisition of diagnostic technologies that complement our existing platforms, proprietary biomarkers that can result in new product applications of our existing platforms, and new platforms that would complement our commercial strategy.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	6
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Target Markets
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Rapid HIV Tests
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	A large percentage of individuals that are HIV positive worldwide are unaware of their status.&#160; Part of the reason for this is that even those that do get tested in public health settings will often not return or call back for their test results when samples have to be sent out to a laboratory which can take up to several days to process.&#160; The increased availability, greater efficacy and reduced costs for anti-retroviral treatments (ARVs) for HIV has increased the demand for testing, as the stigma associated with the disease is lessened, and the ability to resume normal activities is substantially improved, providing a positive message to those potentially infected.&#160; The impact that rapid HIV testing has had on prevention efforts has in turn increased the demand for testing, particularly by public health programs worldwide, which have also become more effective in reducing the number of annual new infections in many, but by no means all, high prevalence regions.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Despite less attention to HIV by the media as compared with prior years, there are still approximately 50,000 new diagnoses of HIV infection in the United States each year, according to the CDC. CDC estimates that approximately 1.1 million individuals in the U.S. are living with HIV, with an estimated 1 of&#160;8 of these U.S. individuals, or almost 13%, unaware that they are infected.&#160; It is transmissions from these&#160;infected people that are reported to account for the majority of all new infections per year.&#160; Part of the reason for this is that even those individuals that do get tested in public health settings will often not return or call back for their test results if their blood samples&#160; have to be sent out to and tested in a laboratory and then reported back,&#160; a process which can take up to several days to complete.&#160; Making more people aware of their HIV status at the point-of-care reduces the number of HIV transmissions.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Rapid HIV testing in the United States has now developed into an estimated 7.5 million test market at an average price of $10, or a total of $75 million. Public health programs, currently funded by grants distributed to states by the CDC, account for an estimated 45% of the market, with hospitals (40%) and doctor
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s offices (15%) comprising the other estimated market segments.&#160; Chembio
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s&#160;rapid HIV tests represent approximately a 20% share of this market.&#160; OraSure Technologies, Inc., which was the first FDA-approved rapid HIV test, maintains approximately 50% of this market.&#160; Trinity Biotech has an estimated 15% market share and Alere, Biolytical Laboratories, Medmira and Bio-Rad share the remaining 10%.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	In 2006, the outlook for HIV testing was given a big boost with the release by the CDC of new recommendations for HIV testing. These new CDC recommendations were/are that an HIV test should be given as a routine test like any other for all patients between 13 and 64 years of age, regardless of risk, with an opt-out screening option and focused testing procedural (pre- and post-test counseling) guidelines.&#160; Though not mandatory, gradual adoption in whole or in part of the 2006 CDC recommendations by a number of states continues to have an increasing impact.&#160; Finally, in 2013, the United States Preventive Services Task Force (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	USPSTF
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	) fully embraced these CDC routine HIV testing recommendations.&#160; This USPSTF recommendation, which was given an A grade under their recommendation grading system based on the benefits of this practice and the nearly 600,000 AIDS-related deaths in the United States,&#160; requires&#160; insurance coverage under the Affordable Care Act (the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	ACA
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	) as a preventive screening test without any co-payment required. We expect this to result in an increase in HIV testing in the United States in the coming years, which we believe will include point-of-care HIV testing utilizing the Company
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s products.&#160; Although as stated above, currently most public health testing in the United States is funded by grants allocated to high prevalence areas by the CDC, we believe this will shift to an insurance-funded model under the ACA in the years to come, increasing the amount of testing done in doctor
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s offices and community health centers.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	In the international market, we sell our products directly and through distributors to large screening programs overseen by ministries of health and NGOs, most but not all of which are funded by large bi-lateral and multi-lateral AIDS relief programs, the largest of which is the U.S. President
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR).&#160; Established by President George Bush as a 5-year $15 billion program in 2003, PEPFAR was reauthorized in 2008 and again in 2013.&#160; In 2012 PEPFAR directly supported HIV testing and counseling for more than 11 million pregnant women, and testing and counseling for more than 49 million people overall. The U.S. is also the first and largest donor to the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria. To date, the U.S. has provided more than $7 billion to the Fund.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	In December 2013 President Obama signed into law the PEPFAR Stewardship and Oversight Act, which is the most recent reauthorization of PEPFAR. However, unlike the 2008 PEPFAR authorization, which authorized approximately $45 billion, the new law doesn
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	t authorize a specific dollar amount for funding.&#160; Nevertheless it is widely anticipated that PEPFAR will continue to enjoy strong funding; the FY14 budget had $6 billion for global HIV/AIDS assistance, including $4 billion for PEPFAR.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Chembio, with its four U.S.-manufactured rapid HIV tests, all of which are FDA-approved, is recognized as a reputable and dependable supplier of high quality products that are available at reasonably competitive prices.&#160; As a result, certain of our products have been selected in the testing protocols in countries (national algorithms) that are large beneficiaries of PEPFAR and the Global Fund. As mentioned above, these programs can and do often result in large orders, but also can result in periods of relatively lower demand, based on the variations associated with this kind of demand.&#160; Also, even though the United States taxpayer is funding the largest share of global AIDS relief, U.S. companies do not receive any preference for these procurements, and therefore must compete with foreign suppliers that manufacture competitive products with lower costs, including those related to quality, regulatory, intellectual property, and costs of manufacturing.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Oral fluid testing is an established alternative to blood testing for diagnostic tests, including HIV tests.&#160; It is also often patient preferred, providing a more comfortable, less invasive test.&#160; In certain public health clinics, staffs choose not to handle blood specimens; thus, oral sample collection provides a viable alternative.&#160; The most well-established market for oral fluid HIV testing is the United States.&#160; Given the premium price required for an oral fluid test as compared with blood tests, the higher volume programs will not specify an oral fluid test.&#160; However, segments of these programs may want to have an oral fluid testing option, and certain programs that have greater resources may also choose to incorporate oral fluid testing into the testing protocol.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	There is also now an over-the-counter market for HIV self-testing in the United States.&#160; OraSure Technologies Inc. received FDA approval for an over-the-counter (self-testing) version of its previously professional-market-approved (test performed on an individual by a health care professional) HIV test.&#160; The FDA approval was granted in July 2012, and OraSure has been investing heavily in developing this market. Initial results after over two years of marketing are well below expectations.&#160; The costs for such over-the-counter approval, including primarily the associated clinical trials, are estimated to be at least $5 million and they may take two to three years to complete, not to mention the cost of distribution.&#160; OraSure
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s initial results are not convincing of a large market, although this possibility remains.&#160; If it appears that there is an attractive market, we believe we are very well positioned to participate in this market.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Rapid HIV-Syphilis Test
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	There are significant risks relating to transmission of Syphilis from a pregnant mother to child, just as there are for transmission of HIV.&#160; Therefore we believe there is a significant opportunity to improve prevention efforts in pregnant mother to child transmission testing programs (PMTCT) that are currently not doing any or nearly enough testing for syphilis even though they are testing for HIV.&#160; In the United States, we believe there is also a significant need for this product in some of the highest HIV prevalence populations, such as among men that have sex with men (MSM), as data show high degrees of HIV and Syphilis co-infection in this segment of the population.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	7
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Marketing Strategy
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: -36PT">
	Our marketing strategy is to:
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="BBFE44220EDB4EDD9230DDA90E57BA04" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Market our DPP&#174; HIV 1/2 Assay, HIV 1/2 STAT-PAK&#174; Assay and future DPP&#174; based new products in the US through our internal sales and marketing organization and selected channel partners (e.g., McKesson/PSS, Fisher Healthcare, Henry Schein, etc.).&#160; Chembio, following the June 2014 termination of the STAT-PAK&#174; agreement with Alere, does not have to share any portion of the net sales proceeds for STAT-PAK&#174; with Alere.&#160; This decision resulted in incurring expenditures related to hiring sales representatives, establishing agreements and associated discounts with distributors, incurring advertising and marketing expenditures, warehousing, customer service and technical support. If Alere's new competitive product is indeed successful, our ability to retain a significant share of the market that has been established for our products may be enhanced by our having control of the marketing of our products, rather than relying on Alere to sell both our products while it is also selling its own competing product. We are leveraging the same sales force for U.S. Sales of DPP&#174; HIV 1/2 Assay.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="ADAAD6804C8D447281A784B7E71ECE92" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We will support, review and assess the marketing and distribution efforts of our rapid HIV barrel test in the U.S.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="E01A46A2ABEE4D3C8BBDA32EABF84D2D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Outside the U.S., we will market our products primarily through commercial collaborators and distribution partners.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="4B0D9963CBDD4BC38F4EF04D884B4ABF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Leverage our DPP&#174; intellectual property and product development and manufacturing experience to continue creating new collaborations where Chembio can be the exclusive development and manufacturing partner supporting leading marketing organizations.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="A1F98C507B894DA39EF499F0E1562512" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Establish strong distribution relationships for our Chembio-branded products in the U.S and abroad, and establish a direct sales and marketing organization that is focused in the public health market segment, and that utilizes distributors for other market segments, primarily the acute care market which, together with public health, are the main market segments for rapid HIV tests in the United States.&#160; We believe that creation of a Chembio public health brand and marketing organization is fundamental to the creation of shareholder value over the long-term.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We have increased our commercial activities and efforts in Africa, Europe and Asia for our HIV tests and product pipeline.&#160; We believe these efforts will enable us to be more closely engaged with opportunities to engage with customers and partners and to participate in the national testing algorithms that are established and revised from time to time by countries that are beneficiaries of PEPFAR, Global Fund and/or other bilateral or multilateral donor funding.&#160; In Europe, where there are a larger percentage of HIV positive people unaware of their status than in the United States, we believe that there is an emerging public health outreach opportunity, and there are relatively few strong competitors that are CE-marked.&#160; Most recently we have established new sales and marketing positions in the Company to support our efforts to increase brand awareness globally and to lead our direct sales effort in the U.S. market.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Competition
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	The diagnostics industry is a multi-billion dollar international industry and is intensely competitive.&#160; Many of our competitors are substantially larger and have greater financial, research, manufacturing and marketing resources.&#160; Industry competition in general is based on the following:
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="245D0C9DE0174644A719A0D55416B592" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">

	&#183;
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Scientific and technological capability;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="5B5B67E613EE420786325142A5CDD022" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	Proprietary know-how;

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="422437F42CED448292E0B0139855A758" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	The ability to develop and market products and processes;
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="B8D6F27BFE4A40CE9A1032754F818B6A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<TABLE ID="37097AE06FB245F787D5A2E66E3A238B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	s Quality System Regulations) (see Governmental Regulation section);

<DIV>
<TABLE ID="BAC2429E8F5346A18F2DD0A2A213EF79" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>

	The ability to manufacture products cost-effectively;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="2326A488A0B94EB2B450E3DFF16E7F7A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Access to adequate capital;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="18794D4E656B4595A728A8E875C7B873" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The ability to attract and retain qualified personnel; and
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="7ACD07286CEE4AFA9BBBE4D4856DBE1A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The availability of patent protection.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	We believe our scientific and technological capabilities and our proprietary know-how relating to our in-licensed lateral flow technology rapid tests and to our proprietary know-how related to our patented DPP&#174; technology, particularly for the development and manufacture of tests for the detection of antibodies to infectious diseases such as HIV, are very strong.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Our ability to develop and market other products is in large measure dependent on our having additional resources and/or collaborative relationships.&#160; Some of our product development efforts have been funded on a project or milestone basis.&#160; We believe that our proprietary know-how in lateral flow technology and in our DPP&#174; technology has been instrumental in our obtaining the collaborations we have and that we continue to pursue.&#160; We believe that the patent protection that we have with our DPP&#174; technology enhances our ability to develop more profitable collaborative relationships and to license out the technology.&#160; However there are a number of competitive technologies used and/or seeking to be used in point-of-care settings.&#160; These technologies may be based on immunoassay principles such as the Company
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s products or other technologies, such as molecular-based technologies.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	We launched our FDA-approved DPP&#174; HIV 1/2 Assay, which test also can be used with either oral fluid or blood samples, in the U.S. market under a Chembio brand in the fourth quarter of 2014.&#160; OraSure Technologies manufactures the only other rapid, oral fluid HIV test that is FDA-approved, and OraSure has enjoyed this position for approximately 10 years.&#160; OraSure has lost a significant share of this market as certain customers have been indifferent to using blood or oral fluid samples, because the blood tests, including those made/marketed by Chembio and marketed by Alere, are priced lower and/or are as or more accurate than the performance of OraSure
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s product on blood samples.&#160; OraSure has primarily retained those customers for whom the oral fluid sample feature is a strong preference, and this is an estimated $35 million business for OraSure.&#160; Although we believe we can capture a meaningful portion of this OraSure market share, we also anticipate that OraSure will defend this business aggressively.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	8
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	In 2006 Alere acquired a division from Abbott Diagnostic located in Japan that manufactured and marketed a rapid HIV test product line called Determine&#174;.&#160; The Determine&#174; format was developed for the developing world and remote settings and, central to the needs of that market, the format is essentially a test strip that is integrated&#160; into a thin foil wrapper that, when opened, the underside of the wrapper serves as the test surface for applying the blood sample and performing the test.&#160; This design reduces costs and shipping weights and volumes and is an advantage for the developing world markets it has served.&#160; Some of the disadvantages of the platform are the amount of blood sample that is needed (50 microliters versus 2.5, 5 and 10 for our lateral flow barrel, lateral flow cassette, and DPP&#174; products respectively),&#160; the open nature of the test surface, and the absence of a true control that differentiates biological from other kinds of samples.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	The so-called
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	3rd generation
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	version of this product has been marketed for many years and is the leading rapid HIV test that is used in a large majority of the national algorithms of countries funded by PEPFAR and the Global Fund, as well as many other countries in the world.&#160; That product is not FDA-approved though it is CE-marked. The newest Determine&#174; HIV version, which was developed and manufactured at Alere
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s subsidiary in Israel, Orgenics, is the so-called
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	4th Generation
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	version Determine&#174; test. According to its claims, this product detects HIV antibodies and P24 HIV antigens. Since the P24 antigen is known to occur in HIV-positive individuals
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	blood samples before antibodies do, based on its performance claims, the 4th generation Determine&#174; test is&#160; therefore able to detect HIV infection earlier than tests that solely rely on antibody detection. Chembio
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s tests, as well as all of the other currently FDA-approved rapid HIV tests, only detect antibodies.&#160; There are however laboratory tests that are FDA-approved that are
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	4th generation
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	tests, but they are of course neither rapid nor point-of-care.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	The initial
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	4th generation
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	Alere Determine&#174; rapid test product that was also CE-marked and that Alere launched internationally some years ago has not been successfully commercialized to the best of our knowledge and at&#160; least certain published studies were not favorable for this product.&#160; However the 4th generation product that is now FDA-approved was apparently modified as compared to the initial international version of it, and it may perform more satisfactorily.&#160; Alere received FDA approval of this modified product in August 2013 and CLIA-waiver for it in the fourth quarter of 2014.&#160; There is support by a number of key opinion leaders for the public health value of such 4th generation tests, and it represents a significant competitive threat to Chembio as well as to each of the other rapid HIV test manufacturers (OraSure and Trinity primarily).
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	During 2011 Biolytical, Inc. of Vancouver, Canada received FDA approval and in 2012 received CLIA waiver of a flow-through rapid HIV test called
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	INSTI
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	.&#160; The technology used in the INSTI test, flow-through, is older than lateral flow, and it requires handling of multiple components (3 vials of solution) to perform the test in multiple steps.&#160; However, these steps can be accomplished in less than ten minutes, and the actual test results occur in only one minute after those steps are completed.&#160; Therefore sample-to-result time is shorter than any of the competitive products.&#160; There are settings where that reduced total test time, despite the multiple steps required, may be a distinct advantage, and we believe Biolytical has made some progress in penetrating certain public health markets.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Although we have no specific knowledge of any other competitors
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	products that are a competitive threat to our products, or that will render our products obsolete, if we fail to maintain and enhance our competitive position or fail to introduce new products and product features, our customers may decide to use the products developed by our competitors, which could result in a loss of revenues and cash flow.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Research and Development
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	During 2015 and 2014, we spent $6.4 million and $4.8 million, respectively, on research and development (including regulatory activities).&#160; These expenses were in part underwritten by funding from R&amp;D and milestones revenues of $2.3 million in 2015 and $1.7 million in 2014.&#160; All of our new product development activities involve employment of our DPP&#174; technology.&#160; These activities include completing development of certain products and making significant progress toward the development of additional products.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Employees
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	At December 31, 2015, we employed approximately155 people.&#160; We have entered into employment contracts with our Chief Executive Officer and President, John J. Sperzel, our Chief Operating Officer, Sharon Klugewicz, and our Chief Science and Technology Officer, Javan Esfandiari.&#160; Due to the specific knowledge and experience of these executives regarding the industry, technology and market, the loss of the services of any one of them would likely have a material adverse effect on the Company.&#160;&#160; The contract with Ms. Klugewicz, has a term of two years ending May 2017.&#160; The contract with Mr. Esfandiari has a term of three years ending March 2016.&#160;&#160;The Company and Mr. Esfandiari currently are discussing terms for renewal of his employment agreement.&#160;&#160;We have obtained a key man insurance policy for Mr. Esfandiari.&#160; The contract with Mr. Sperzel provides that Mr. Sperzel will serve as the Chief Executive Officer and President of the Company through March 2017.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Governmental Regulation
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	The manufacturing and marketing of the Company
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s existing and proposed diagnostic products are regulated by the United States Food and Drug Administration (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	FDA
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	), United States Department of Agriculture (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	USDA
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	), certain state and local agencies, and/or comparable regulatory bodies in other countries.&#160; These regulations govern almost all aspects of development, production and marketing, including product testing, authorizations to market, labeling, promotion, manufacturing and record keeping.&#160; The Company
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s FDA and USDA regulated products require some form of action by each agency before they can be marketed in the United States, and, after approval or clearance, the Company must continue to comply with other FDA requirements applicable to marketed products, e.g. Quality Systems (for medical devices).&#160; Failure to comply with the FDA
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s requirements can lead to significant penalties, both before and after approval or clearance.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	There are two review procedures by which medical devices can receive FDA clearance or approval.&#160; Some products may qualify for clearance under Section 510(k) of the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, in which the manufacturer provides a pre-market notification that it intends to begin marketing the product, and shows that the product is substantially equivalent to another legally marketed product (i.e., that it has the same intended use and is as safe and effective as a legally marketed device and does not raise different questions of safety and effectiveness).&#160; In some cases, the submission must include data from human clinical studies.&#160; Marketing may commence when the FDA issues a clearance letter finding such substantial equivalence.&#160; FDA clearance of our DPP&#174; Syphilis Screen &amp; Confirm test will be by means of a 510(k) submission.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	If the medical device does not qualify for the 510(k) procedure (either because it is not substantially equivalent to a legally marketed device or because it is required by statute and the FDA
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s implementing regulations have an approved application), the FDA must approve a Pre-Marketing Application (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	PMA
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	) before marketing can begin.&#160; PMA
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s must demonstrate, among other matters, that the medical device provides a reasonable assurance of safety and effectiveness.&#160; A PMA application is typically a complex submission, including the results of non-clinical and clinical studies.&#160; Preparing a PMA application is a much more expensive, detailed and time-consuming process as compared with a 510(K) pre-market notification.&#160; The Company has approved PMAs for the two rapid HIV tests now marketed in the U.S.: both our HIV 1/2 STAT-PAK&#174; and also our test that currently is marketed in the U.S. by Alere Medical as Clearview&#174; Complete HIV 1/2 and Clearview&#174; HIV 1/2 STAT PAK&#174;.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	FDA approval of our DPP&#174; HIV screening assay for use with oral fluid or blood samples also was achieved by means of a PMA application.&#160; The Clinical Laboratory Improvement Act of 1988 (
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	CLIA
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	) prohibits laboratories from performing in-vitro tests for the purpose of providing information for the diagnosis, prevention or treatment of any disease or impairment of, or the assessment of, the health of human beings unless there is in effect for such laboratories a certificate issued by the United States Department of Health and Human Services (via the FDA) applicable to the category of examination or procedure performed.&#160; Although a certificate is not required for the Company, it considers the applicability of the requirements of CLIA in the design and development of its products.&#160; The statutory definition of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	laboratory
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	is very broad, and many of our customers are considered labs.&#160; A CLIA waiver will remove certain quality control and other requirements that must be met for certain customers to use the Company
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	'
</FONT>
	s products and this is critical to the marketability of a product into the point-of-care diagnostics market.&#160; The Company has received a CLIA waiver for each of the two lateral flow rapid HIV tests now marketed in the U.S.&#160; The CLIA waiver was granted by the FDA for HIV 1/2 STAT-PAK&#174; on November 20, 2006 and for the Clearview&#174; Complete HIV 1/2 on October 22, 2007.&#160; In 2008 the FDA revised its CLIA waiver requirements so that an additional prospective trial need be conducted in order to demonstrate clinical utility by showing that the device is capable of identifying new infections when used by untrained users.&#160; Our DPP&#174; HIV 1/2 test received CLIA waiver in October of 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	9
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	In addition, the FDA regulates the export of medical devices that have not been approved for marketing in the United States.&#160; The Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act contains general requirements for any medical device that may not be sold in the United States and is intended for export.&#160; Specifically, a medical device intended for export is not deemed to be adulterated or misbranded if the product: (1) complies with the specifications of the foreign purchaser; (2) is not in conflict with the laws of the country to which it is intended for export; (3) is prominently labeled on the outside of the shipping package that it is intended for export; and (4) is not sold or offered for sale in the United States.&#160; However, the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act does permit the export of devices to any country in the world, if the device complies with the laws of the importing country and has valid marketing authorization in one of several
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	listed
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'">
	"
</FONT>
	countries under the theory that these listed countries have sophisticated mechanisms for the review of medical devices for safety and effectiveness.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	The Company is also subject to regulations in foreign countries governing products, human clinical trials and marketing, and may need to obtain approval or evaluations by international public health agencies, such as the World Health Organization, in order to sell diagnostic products in certain countries.&#160; Approval processes vary from country to country, and the length of time required for approval or to obtain other clearances may in some cases be longer than that required for United States governmental approvals.&#160; On the other hand, the fact that our HIV diagnostic tests are of value in the AIDS epidemic may lead to some government process being expedited.&#160; The extent of potentially adverse governmental regulation affecting Chembio that might arise from future legislative or administrative action cannot be predicted.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Environmental Laws
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	To date, we have not encountered any costs relating to compliance with any environmental laws.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN BOLD'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36PT">
	Intellectual Property
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Intellectual Property Strategy
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Our intellectual property strategy is to:&#160; (1) build our own intellectual property portfolio around our DPP&#174; technology; (2) pursue licenses, trade secrets and know-how within the area of rapid point-of-care testing, and (3) develop and acquire proprietary positions to reagents and new hardware platforms for the development and manufacture of rapid diagnostic tests.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company has obtained patent coverage on the DPP&#174; technology, including four U.S. patents, and patents in China, Malaysia, Eurasia, Mexico, Singapore, Japan, Australia, Indonesia, Korea and the U.K.&#160; Additional patent applications on the DPP&#174; technology are pending in the U.S., as well as in many foreign countries such as Brazil, Canada, the European Union, India, Israel, and South Africa.&#160; Patents have also been filed on extensions to the DPP&#174; product line concept, such as 4th generation assays.&#160; The four U.S. patents are as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
