<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="F9A3C510EE9846808B038EA6F49BA170" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 54PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	ITEM 7.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Overview
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	This discussion and analysis should be read in conjunction with the accompanying Consolidated Financial Statements and related notes.&#160;&#160;Our discussion and analysis of our financial condition and results of operations are based upon our consolidated financial statements, which have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States. The preparation of financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America requires us to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities, disclosure of any contingent liabilities at the financial statement date and reported amounts of revenue and expenses during the reporting period. On an ongoing basis, we review our estimates and assumptions. Our estimates are based on our historical experience and other assumptions that we believe to be reasonable under the circumstances. Actual results are likely to differ from those estimates under different assumptions or conditions, but we do not believe such differences will materially affect our financial position or results of operations. Our critical accounting policies, the policies we believe are most important to the presentation of our financial statements and require the most difficult, subjective and complex judgments, are outlined below in ''Critical Accounting Policies,'' and have not changed significantly.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In addition, certain statements made in this report may constitute "forward-looking statements".&#160;&#160;These forward-looking statements involve known or unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors that may cause the actual results, performance or achievements of the Company to be materially different from any future results, performance or achievements expressed or implied by the forward-looking statements. These factors include, among others, 1) our ability to obtain necessary regulatory approvals for our products; and 2) our ability to increase revenues and operating income, which is dependent upon our ability to develop and sell our products, general economic conditions, demand for our products, and other factors. You can identify forward-looking statements by terminology such as "may," "could", "will," "should," "expects," "intends," "plans," "anticipates," "believes," "estimates," "predicts," "potential," "continues" or the negative of these terms or other comparable terminology. Although we believe that the expectations reflected in the forward-looking statements are reasonable, we cannot guarantee future results, levels of activity, performance or achievements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Except as may be required by applicable law, we do not undertake or intend to update or revise our forward-looking statements, and we assume no obligation to update any forward-looking statements contained in this report as a result of new information or future events or developments.&#160;&#160;Thus, you should not assume that our silence over time means that actual events are bearing out as expressed or implied in such forward-looking statements.&#160;&#160;You should carefully review and consider the various disclosures we make in this report and our other reports filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission that attempt to advise interested parties of the risks, uncertainties and other factors that may affect our business.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	All of the Company's future products that are currently being developed are based on its patented Dual Path Platform (DPP&#174;), which is a unique diagnostic point-of-care platform that has certain advantages over lateral flow technology. The Company has completed development of several products that employ the DPP&#174; technology which are currently marketed under Chembio's label (DPP&#174; HIV 1/2 Screening Assay and DPP&#174; HIV 1/2 &#8211;Syphilis Assay), or which may be marketed pursuant to private label license or distribution agreements such as those with the Oswaldo Cruz Foundation ("FIOCRUZ") and Bio-Rad.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Research and development ("R&amp;D"), milestone, and grant and royalty revenues for the year ended December 31, 2015 increased to $2,369,000 from $1,696,000 in the prior-year, which was the result of additional grants awarded in 2015 over 2014.&#160; R&amp;D expenses in the year of 2015 were $6.38 million, compared with $4.83 million in the prior-year.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Research &amp; Development Activities
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Sexually Transmitted Disease
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="8A09E91D6ACE482B9021DD46A9AD74C3" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	DPP&#174; HIV-Syphilis Assay:&#160; The DPP&#174; HIV-Syphilis Assay is a rapid, point-of-care (POC), multiplex test for the simultaneous detection of antibodies to HIV and to Treponema Pallidum (TP) bacteria (the causative agent of syphilis).&#160; This novel combination assay was developed to address the growing concern among public health officials regarding the rising co-infection rates of HIV and syphilis as well as mother-to-child transmission (MTCT) of HIV and syphilis.&#160; The product was successfully launched in Mexico during 2014, and received approval for commercial use by the Brazilian regulatory agency, Ag&#234;ncia Nacional de Vigil&#226;ncia Sanit&#225;ria (ANVISA). The DPP&#174; HIV-Syphilis Assay is the only test cleared for commercialization in Brazil for rapid, POC detection of both HIV 1/2 and syphilis.&#160; We are developing a U.S. version of the DPP&#174; HIV-Syphilis Assay, designed to meet the performance requirements for the "reverse" algorithm that is currently in clinical use for syphilis testing in the United States.&#160; We have completed our pre-clinical studies for this product with encouraging results, and are in the final stages of clinical site selection for our U.S. clinical studies.&#160; We plan to begin this clinical trial in the U.S. during first quarter of 2016, and expect that the trial will be completed in six to nine months from initiation.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Fever Disease
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="52D5F565BAE94D7380980CBC8B051194" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	DPP&#174; Malaria Assay: The DPP&#174; Malaria Assay is a rapid, POC, multiplex test for the simultaneous detection of plasmodium falciparum and other plasmodium infections.&#160; In January 2015, we received a grant from The Bill &amp; Melinda Gates Foundation to expedite the development and feasibility testing of a POC DPP&#174; Malaria Assay. The Company recently completed this project, which compared the new DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Malaria Assay to the world's leading currently-available POC malaria assay. Based on initial testing, the new DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Malaria Assay met the major objective of the feasibility project: a ten-fold improvement in sensitivity. Given these results, we plan to develop and commercialize a family of DPP&#174; Malaria Assays.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="FB4509D9022248F28E66653DC06F9FC4" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	DPP&#174; Fever Panel Assay:&#160; The DPP&#174; Fever Panel Assay is a rapid, POC, multiplex test for the simultaneous detection of Malaria, Dengue, Chikungunya, Zika, Ebola, Lassa, and Marburg. In October 2015, we received a $2.1 million grant from the Paul G. Allen Ebola Program, to develop the DPP&#174;
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	Fever Panel Assay and a follow-on grant to add a test for the detection of Zika virus. We plan to be ready for field testing in the fourth quarter of 2016.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="5F84D99C4D254FFBA7807A8388DE43D6" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	DPP&#174; Ebola Assay and DPP&#174;
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	Malaria-Ebola Assay:&#160; The DPP&#174; Ebola Assay is a rapid POC test for the detection of Ebola&#160; and the DPP&#174; Malaria-Ebola Assay is a rapid, POC, multiplex test for the simultaneous detection of Malaria and Ebola.&#160; In October 2014, we announced plans to develop, validate, and commercialize POC DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Assays for Ebola and Febrile Illness.&#160; We completed the development of the DPP&#174; Ebola Assay and submitted it for Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) with the Food &amp; Drug Administration (FDA) and World Health Organization (WHO). During the third and fourth quarters of 2015, we sold DPP&#174; Ebola and DPP&#174; Malaria-Ebola Assays to the Centers for Disease Control &amp; Prevention (CDC) for field studies in West Africa, which is ongoing.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="29B09B59E7034B6FBD678847B7A332D7" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	DPP&#174; Dengue Fever Assay:&#160; The DPP&#174; Dengue Fever Assay is a rapid, POC, multiplex test for the simultaneous detection of IgG/IgM and NS1 antigens.&#160; We are currently conducting verification and validation studies, and we anticipate the production of pilot lots, to support preclinical studies.&#160; We anticipate starting pre-clinical studies in the second quarter of 2016. This program is fully funded by a partner.&#160; However, under the terms of our agreement, Chembio's partner is not being disclosed.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="01A3FB1F47A5400CA0D3E66B758802C1" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">

	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	DPP&#174; Zika Assays:&#160;The DPP&#174; Zika Assay is a rapid POC stand-alone test for the simultaneous detection of IgG/IgM antibodies and the DPP&#174; Dengue/Chikungunya/Zika Assay is a rapid, POC, multiplex test for the simultaneous detection of IgG/IgM antibodies.&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="B9A0198023D145B892981A2FED1E64B5" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	18
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage20"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Technology Collaboration
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="02ED748946CB45AF970BB2E1421FF0EA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	DPP&#174; Cancer Assay:&#160;The DPP&#174; Cancer Assay is a rapid, POC, multiplex test for the early detection and monitoring of a specific type of cancer. In October 2014, we entered into collaboration with an international diagnostics company to develop a POC diagnostic test for a specific type of cancer.&#160; This program is fully funded by a partner.&#160; However, under the terms of the agreement, neither Chembio's partner nor the specific type of cancer is being disclosed. The cancer project represents an application of the DPP&#174; technology outside of the infectious disease field, and the scope of the agreement involves product development of a quantitative, reader-based cancer assay for two cancer markers, utilizing Chembio's DPP&#174; technology and DPP&#174; Micro Reader.&#160;&#160; During the third quarter of 2015, we completed successful feasibility, and our partner agreed to fund continued development of the DPP&#174; Cancer Assay.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="9B877A345DFC4DEB91CAD0D7A4FB1D50" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	DPP&#174; Traumatic Brain Injury Assay: The DPP&#174; Traumatic Brain Injury Assay is a rapid POC test for the detection of traumatic brain injury (TBI) and sports-related concussion. In January 2015, we entered into an agreement with the Concussion Science Group (CSG) Division of Perseus Science Group LLC, to combine CSG's patented biomarker with our proprietary DPP&#174; platform and DPP&#174; Micro Reader, to develop a semi-quantitative or quantitative POC test, to diagnose TBI. In May 2015, an Informational Meeting was conducted at the FDA to present the technology and intended use, as well to initiate dialogue regarding the regulatory pathway for this product. The DPP&#174; Traumatic Brain Injury Assay is in the feasibility stage.&#160; We are currently working with several hospitals to finalize institutional review board (IRB) agreements and develop the plan for conducting initial studies of the DPP&#174; Traumatic Brain Injury Assay using patient samples.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="61805BF0CC3F4E199DC257A326EB5292" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	DPP&#174; FLU Immunostatus Assay: The DPP&#174; FLU Immunostatus Assay is a rapid, POC, multiplex influenza immunity test. In November 2014, we entered into a follow-on, milestone-based development agreement with a contracting organization acting on behalf of the U.S. government, for a multiplex POC influenza immunity test utilizing our patented DPP&#174; technology.&#160; We successfully completed the product development of a 7-band multiplex DPP&#174; Flu Immunostatus Assay with a digital reader during the first quarter of 2015 and subsequently applied for additional funding in response to a new request for proposal (RFP) from the U.S. Government, for which we expect a response in the&#160;second quarter&#160;of 2016.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Regulatory Activities
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	DPP&#174; HIV 1/2 Assay:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	In May 2015 we received
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	approval for a CE Mark for the DPP&#174; HIV 1/2 Assay for Oral Fluid, Serum, Plasma, Fingerstick Whole Blood and Venous Whole Blood. The Chembio DPP&#174; HIV 1/2 Assay for rapid, POC detection of HIV is now cleared for commercialization and sale within the 28 member states of the&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	European Union
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	DPP&#174; HIV-Syphilis:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	DPP&#174; HIV-Syphilis Assay is a rapid,&#160;POC, multiplex test for the simultaneous detection of antibodies to HIV and to Treponema Pallidum (TP) bacteria (the causative agent of syphilis).&#160; This novel combination assay was developed to address the growing concern among public health officials regarding the rising co-infection rates of HIV and syphilis as well as mother-to-child transmission (MTCT) of HIV and syphilis.&#160; The product was successfully launched in Mexico during 2014, and received approval for commercial use by the Brazilian regulatory agency, Ag&#234;ncia Nacional de Vigil&#226;ncia Sanit&#225;ria (ANVISA). The DPP&#174; HIV-Syphilis Assay is the only test cleared for commercialization in Brazil for rapid, POC detection of both HIV 1/2 and syphilis.&#160; In December 2015, the application by way of technical file was submitted to the Notified Body for CE Mark consideration to commercialize
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	within the&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	European Union
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We have developed a U.S. version of the DPP&#174; HIV-Syphilis Assay, designed to meet the performance requirements for the "reverse" algorithm that is currently in clinical use for syphilis testing in the United States.&#160; We have completed our pre-clinical studies for this product with encouraging results, and have identified clinical sites for our U.S. clinical studies.&#160; We plan to begin this clinical trial in the U.S. during first quarter of 2016, and expect that the trial will be completed in six to nine months from initiation.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	There can be no assurance that any of the aforementioned Research &amp; Development&#160;&#160;and/or Regulatory products or activities will result in any product approvals or commercialization, nor that any of the existing research and development activities, or any new potential development programs or collaborations will materialize or that they will meet regulatory or any other technical requirements and specifications, and/or that if continued, will result in completed products, or that such products, if they are successfully completed, can or will be successfully commercialized.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Recent Events
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On February 19, 2016, the Company announced it had been awarded a $550,000 grant from philanthropist and entrepreneur Paul G. Allen to immediately initiate development of simple, cost-effective POC diagnostic tests to identify Zika virus and related febrile illnesses. The grant is managed by Mr. Allen's company, Vulcan Inc., and the funds come from the Paul G. Allen Family Foundation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On March 7, 2016, the Company announced plans to collaborate with Bio-Manguinhos/Fiocruz to undertake to develop, register and commercialize POC DPP&#174; Zika Assays for Brazil. The Company has developed a prototype DPP&#174; Zika Assay and prototype DPP&#174; Zika/Dengue/Chikungunya Assay, and we hope to receive additional funding, along with the grant mentioned above, to accelerate the development and testing of our DPP&#174; Zika Assays.&#160; The Company anticipates receiving significant orders for DPP&#174; Zika Assays in 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	19
</DIV>

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage21"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2015 AS COMPARED WITH THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'">
<U>
	Income
</U>
</FONT>
	:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December 31, 2015, Loss before income taxes was $(3,557,000) compared to Loss before income taxes of $(1,550,000) for the year ended December 31, 2014.&#160; Net Loss for the 2015 period was $(2,397,000) as compared to a Net Loss of $(1,137,000) for 2014.&#160; The change in Net Loss is primarily attributable to decreased revenue and gross margin, and increased operating expenses.&#160; Gross margin decreased in the year ended December 31, 2015 as compared with the year ended December 31, 2014, by $327,000, or 3.0%.&#160; The increased operating expenses, the most significant of which were an increase in wages and related expenses of $779,000, an increase in materials and supplies for R&amp;D of $758,000, and increased clinical trial expenses of $161,000 , partially offset by decreased commission expenses of $141,000, accounted for most of the change in Net Loss.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenues for our lateral flow HIV tests and related components during the year ended December 31, 2015 increased by approximately $440,000 from the same period in 2014.&#160; This was primarily attributable to increased sales to Africa, of approximately $1,576,000 and increased sales to Europe of $973,000, partially offset by decreased sales to the U.S. of $1,604,000, and decreased sales&#160;to Mexico of $458,000.&#160; Revenues for our DPP&#174; products during the year ended December 31, 2015 decreased by approximately $4,390,000 over the same period in 2014, primarily for decreases in sales in Mexico of $3,455,000 and decreases in sales&#160; in Brazil to FIOCRUZ of $2,112,000, partially offset by increased sales in the U.S. of $1,011,000.&#160; The increase in R&amp;D, and in milestone and grant revenue, was primarily due to revenues from certain development projects that were awarded during the period.&#160; R&amp;D revenues include funds, recognized on an "as expenses are incurred" basis or on a milestone basis, from various grants, see footnote 14 of our financial statements. &#160;&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

</EFX_INCOME_STATEMENT>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The overall gross margin dollar decrease of $327,000 included a $1,000,000 decrease in gross margin from net product sales and a $673,000 increase in non-product revenues. The decrease in net product sales gross margin of $1,000,000 is primarily attributable to the change in product sales compared to 2014. The net product sales gross margin decrease is comprised of two components, one is the decrease in product sales of $4,063,000, which at the 35.1% margin contributed $1,428,000 to the decrease, and the other is the increased change in margin percentage of 2.0% which&#160; contributed the balance of&#160; $427,000.&#160; The 2.0% increase in the percentage, from 35.1% in 2014 to 37.1% in 2015, was primarily due to increased efficiencies from our operations excellence program.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Expenses for Clinical&#160;and Regulatory Affairs for the year ended December 31, 2015 increased by $201,000 as compared to the same period in 2014. This was primarily due to an increase of $161,000 in clinical trial expenses and increased wages and related costs of $42,000.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	R&amp;D expenses other than Clinical &amp; Regulatory Affairs increased by $1,344,000 in the year ended December 31, 2015, as compared with the same period in 2014.&#160; The increases were primarily related to an increase in wages and related costs, and in material and supplies, to support our sponsored research and internal development programs.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Selling, general and administrative expenses for the year ended December 31, 2015, increased by $131,000 as compared with the same period in 2014, a 1.7% increase.&#160; This increase resulted primarily from increases in wages and related costs and travel expenses, which for 2015 included the continued development of a sales and marketing team over 2014, professional fees and in investor relations/investment bankers, which were partially offset by decreases in consulting, commissions (due to decreased sales to Brazil), stock-based compensation, and marketing materials.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	21
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Other (expense) for the year ended December 31, 2015 decreased approximately $3,400, primarily due to decreased interest income, compared to the same period in 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Income tax provision (benefit):
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December 31, 2015 the Company recognized a $(1,160,000) income tax benefit and increased its deferred tax assets by $(1,160,000).&#160; For the year ended December 31, 2014, the Company recognized a $(413,000) income tax benefit and increased its deferred tax assets by $(403,000).&#160; The effective tax rate used to recognize the benefit in 2015 was 32.0% compared to a 26.6% rate used in 2014 to record the amount charged.&#160; In both years non-deductible expenses for tax purposes accounted for most of the difference from the standard 34% U.S. tax rate.&#160; The Company maintains a full valuation allowance on research and development tax credits
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Cash increased by $762,000 from December 31,2014, primarily due to net cash provided by operating activities for the year of 2015.&#160; In addition there were decreases in accounts receivable, net of allowance, of $5,916,000, fixed assets of $424,000 after depreciation, license agreements of $157,000, accounts payable and accrued liabilities of $2,145,000, and increases in non-current deferred tax asset of $1,436,000 and&#160;in prepaid expenses of $190,000.&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The decrease in accounts receivable was primarily attributable to the lower amount of credit sales at the end of December 2015 versus December 2014.&#160; The decrease in fixed assets is primarily due to depreciation.&#160; The increase in prepaid and other current assets is due to the current portion of additional licenses.&#160; Deferred tax asset decrease is related to recording of a valuation allowance.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

	22
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company's cash increased as of December 31, 2015 by $762,000 from December 31, 2014, primarily due to net cash provided by operating activities and partially offset by cash used in investing activities for year of 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The cash provided by operations in 2015 was $1,793,000, primarily due to a decrease in accounts receivable of $5,916,000, a decrease in inventories of $60,000 and an increase in&#160;deferred revenue of $13,000, partially offset by an increase in prepaid and other current assets of $191,000, a decrease in accounts payable and other accrued liabilities of $2,145,000 and a net loss net of non-cash items of $1,861,000.&#160; Net loss net of non-cash items includes net loss of $2,397,000, $1,171,000 in income tax benefit, partially offset by $1,373,000 in depreciation and amortization, and $334,000 in share-based compensation.&#160; The use of cash from investing activities is primarily the purchase of fixed assets and acquisition of licenses.&#160;&#160; &#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Fixed Asset Commitments
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company had paid deposits on various pieces of equipment aggregating $30,918 which is reflected in Other Assets on the balance sheet.&#160;&#160;The Company is further committed to additional equipment-purchase obligation of $31,000 as various milestones are achieved by the various vendors.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	23
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage25"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	RECENT DEVELOPMENTS AND CHEMBIO'S PLAN OF OPERATIONS FOR THE NEXT TWELVE MONTHS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During 2015, Chembio took important strategic steps to expand our patented DPP&#174; technology to new markets.&#160; While the Company continues to strengthen its sexually transmitted disease business, we are also building robust product pipelines in two new areas: fever disease and technology collaborations.&#160; As sexually transmitted disease products continue to make important contributions to our business, we believe our new fever disease portfolio and technology collaborations will pave the way for future growth.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Sexually Transmitted Diseases
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In the U.S. during 2015, Chembio recorded an increase in lateral flow sales of approximately $440,000 and an increase of DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	sales of more than $1.0 million (primarily as a result of sales to the CDC for DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Malaria-Ebola and DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Ebola Assays), as compared to the respective U.S. sales in 2014.&#160; We are optimistic about the increasing demand for our products in the U.S.&#160;&#160;We will also have full control of SURE CHECK
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	HIV Assay, effective June 1, 2016, to add to our U.S. commercial efforts.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In Latin America, we experienced a decline in sales in 2015 due primarily to a $3.5 million decrease in sales of DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	HIV-Syphilis Assay in Mexico, related to excess inventory from 2014, and a $2.1 million decrease in sales of DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	HIV Assay in Brazil. We expect that our recently announced DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Zika Assay program will expand our sales in this region, and given our initial indications for 2016, we believe Latin America will continue to be a strong market for Chembio.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In Europe, Chembio's partners, AAZ and BioSure, launched sales of Chembio's SURE CHECK
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	HIV 1/2 self-testing kits in the U.K. and France, respectively.&#160; The launch of these private-label, self-testing kits in Europe was a great success, and we received kit orders that totaled approximately $1.0 million in 2015.&#160; HIV continues to pose a significant threat in Europe, and European health agencies aggressively promote the importance of testing for HIV.&#160; We believe our SURE CHECK
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	HIV 1/2 product is particularly well-suited for the emerging European self-testing segment, given its ability to provide simple, fast and reliable detection of antibodies to HIV 1 and HIV 2.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Another important advancement in our sexually transmitted disease business during 2015 is the progress made with our DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	HIV-Syphilis Assay for the U.S. market.&#160; It is an important corporate priority to be the first-to-market in the U.S. with an HIV-Syphilis combination test.&#160; While the Company is already successfully marketing a DPP&#174; HIV-Syphilis combo assay in Latin America, regulatory standards require additional enhancements for the U.S. market and completion of a clinical trial.&#160; We will initiate this clinical trial in the first quarter of 2016.&#160; We anticipate that the trial will be completed in six to nine months and cost between $1.0 and $1.5 million. We are also in the process of submitting the technical dossier for CE Mark which will allow us to commercialize the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	HIV-Syphilis Assay in Europe.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Fever Disease
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In response to the Ebola outbreak in West Africa, our fever disease business was initiated in Q4 2014, and expanded rapidly through 2015.&#160; Today we are collaborating with several of the world's leading health organizations with the goal of containing the spread of fever diseases around the globe through accurate and early diagnosis.&#160; In the last year, our fever disease product portfolio has grown to include the following highly differentiated products:
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="23C0C7E558CE44FEBFE563B73786F21D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Fever Panel Assay which is funded by the Paul G. Allen Ebola Program, is a point-of-care (POC) test for the simultaneous detection of Malaria, Dengue Fever, Chikungunya, Zika, Ebola, Lassa and Marburg;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="D57BDB13C35043D98E87D5A28780E689" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Malaria-Ebola and DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Ebola Assays which were developed through a research collaboration agreement with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), are currently being field tested in West Africa;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="71626CF8BC094634831E834C4AA8D148" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Dengue Fever Assays which have been funded by an undisclosed entity, are currently being field tested in Asia;
</DIV>
</TD>

</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="77326906488846FF85FEBA51F7786D2F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Malaria Assay which has been funded by The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, is 10-times more sensitive than the current world-leading POC malaria test; and,
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="C67AB2C1F2344C6F944B5F586BA30914" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The recently-announced DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Zika Assay, which has received initial funding from the Paul G. Allen Family Foundation.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="D3E7B103D5B1428EB9EB3092F6CA5851" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The recently-announced plans to collaborate with Bio-Manguinhos/Fiocruz to undertake development of POC Zika tests for the Ministry of Health in Brazil.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As we are excited by each of these programs, the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Fever Panel Assay and the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Zika Assay in particular highlight the power, versatility and broad applicability of our DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	technology, and we believe both of these products to be truly groundbreaking.&#160; Our DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Fever Panel Assay will be the first POC diagnostic test capable of testing for multiple fever diseases simultaneously.&#160; We believe this product will significantly improve the diagnosis and care for people in regions where there is regular exposure to fever diseases and their causes.&#160; The sensitivity, specificity and multiplexing capability of the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	technology uniquely suits it for the fever disease market.&#160; Many of these diseases are present in the same regions with nearly identical symptoms.&#160; These factors make it difficult to make an accurate diagnosis and often delay appropriate treatment.&#160; Today, many available POC diagnostics are limited by their lack of the sensitivity and specificity required to identify asymptomatic patients.&#160; Further, there are currently no POC diagnostics capable of testing for multiple diseases simultaneously.&#160; For these reasons, Chembio is prioritizing development of our DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Fever Panel Assay.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Our new DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Zika Assay development also showcases the exceptional versatility and broad applicability of our DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	technology.&#160; In February, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the Zika virus a 'public health emergency of international concern,' and today the virus has spread to more than twenty countries. In response to the outbreak, we began exploring the feasibility of a POC DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Zika Assay.&#160; We are fortunate that the Paul G. Allen Family Foundation, recognizing the urgency of the matter, moved swiftly to provide Chembio with a grant to support the initiation of the project. We are pleased to report that in a few short weeks, we have developed a prototype assay and are in discussions with a number of agencies, all of which are interested in supporting the rapid development of this critical product.&#160; While this program is in the early stages, we hope that success with the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Zika Assay, like our DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Ebola Assay, will further demonstrate Chembio's ability to rapidly and effectively deploy our DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	technology to address the world's most serious health threats with POC treatment in a practical and efficient manner.&#160; The Company anticipates receiving significant orders for DPP&#174; Zika Assays in 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Technology Collaborations
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Chembio's technology collaborations represent another important business area for the Company.&#160; In the fourth quarter of 2014, we signed collaborative agreements for both the development of the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Cancer Assay for a specific form of cancer, and also for&#160;the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Flu Immunostatus Assay.&#160; In 2015, we added two more&#160;important new collaborations for the development of the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Traumatic Brain Injury Assay and the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Micro Reader.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We are pleased with the progress made with each of these programs in 2015.&#160; The DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Cancer Assay, which is funded by an undisclosed entity, targets a specific form of cancer.&#160; During 2015, we successfully completed the feasibility phase of the program and moved into the product development stage, which is also funded by an undisclosed entity.&#160; The results to-date with this program have been highly encouraging.&#160; With success, we are hopeful that we'll be able to find additional applications for our DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	technology in the broader oncology market.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We also made important advances with our DPP&#174; Traumatic Brain Injury Assay program during the year.&#160; This project, which is funded by Perseus Science Group, LLC, is in the feasibility phase.&#160; We are currently working with several hospitals to finalize institutional review board (IRB) agreements and develop the plan for conducting initial studies of the DPP&#174; Traumatic Brain Injury Assay using patient samples.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	24
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage26"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We are awaiting response on the most recent multi-year grant proposal for completion of the DPP&#174; Flu Immunostatus Assay, a multiplex assay to monitor 9 different seasonal and pandemic flu viruses.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	An addtional new&#160;technology collaboration was signed in the fourth quarter of 2015 with opTricon, a leading developer of mobile analysis devices for rapid diagnostic tests.&#160; Through our exclusive agreement, Chembio will launch the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Micro Reader to complement a number of our proprietary assays for sexually transmitted diseases, certain fever diseases, and a specific form of cancer.&#160; We are particularly excited about offering this technology in combination with our assays.&#160; Using a state-of-the-art camera system, the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Micro Reader is designed to provide definitive diagnostic results for low analyte concentrations, which may otherwise result in faint or ambiguous test results.&#160; In addition, the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Micro Reader will provide customers with various options to capture, record, transmit and store test results.&#160; Because the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Micro Reader is simple, fast, palm-sized, battery-operated and cost-effective compared to traditional POC assay readers, it is unique in its attractiveness and utility, and we believe it will be well-received by the market.&#160; We are working to develop a suite of DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Assay-Reader kits, and we look forward to commercialization of these innovative and versatile diagnostic systems.
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	2015 was an exciting and transformative time for Chembio.&#160; During the year, we significantly expanded the horizon for the utility of our DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	technology.&#160; This has led us to new and exciting applications beyond HIV to fever disease, brain injury, cancer and more.&#160; And in a short amount of time, we gained the attention of, and funding from, world-leading health organizations such as The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, the Paul G. Allen Family Foundation, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and Perseus Science who have aligned with Chembio and selected the DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	technology to address some of the world's most serious diagnostic obstacles.&#160; The events and opportunities of 2015 have considerably changed Chembio by significantly expanding the potential application and markets for our DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	technology. For many diseases, infections or conditions that requires exceptional sensitivity, specificity and/or the ability to multiplex, we believe our DPP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	technology may become the development platform of choice.&#160; Looking ahead to 2016, we will continue to advance each of our development programs, and look for new opportunities and applications.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	25
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">

<A NAME="eolPage27"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The preparation of the financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the amounts reported in the financial statements and accompanying notes.&#160;&#160;Actual results could differ materially from those estimates.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We believe that there are several accounting policies that are critical to understanding our historical and future performance, as these policies affect the reported amounts of revenue and the more significant areas involving management's judgments and estimates.&#160;&#160;These significant accounting policies relate to revenue recognition, research and development costs, valuation of inventory, valuation of long-lived assets and income taxes.&#160;&#160;These policies, and the related procedures, are described in detail below.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenue Recognition &#8211;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We recognize revenue for product sales in accordance with ASC 605, Revenue is recognized when there is persuasive evidence of an arrangement, delivery has occurred or services have been rendered, the sales price is determinable, and collectability is reasonably assured.&#160;&#160;Revenue typically is recognized at time of shipment.&#160;&#160;Sales are recorded net of discounts, rebates and returns.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For certain contracts, we recognize revenue from R&amp;D, milestone and grant revenues when earned.&#160;&#160;Grants are invoiced after expenses are incurred.&#160;&#160;Revenues from projects or grants funded in advance are deferred until earned.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For certain collaborative research projects, we recognize revenue by defining milestones at the inception of the agreement and applying the milestone method of revenue recognition for relevant contracts.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Stock-Based Compensation &#8211;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We recognize the fair value of equity-based awards as compensation expense in our statement of operations. The fair value of our stock option awards was estimated using a Black-Scholes option valuation model. This valuation model's computations incorporate highly subjective assumptions, such as the expected stock price volatility and the estimated life of each award. The fair value of the options, after considering the effect of expected forfeitures, is then amortized, generally on a straight-line basis, over the related vesting period of the option. The fair value of our restricted shares is based on the market value of the shares at the date of grant and is recognized on a straight-line basis over the related vesting period of the award.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Research &amp; Development Costs &#8211;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Research and development activities consist primarily of new product development, continuing engineering for existing products, regulatory and clinical trial costs.&#160;&#160;Costs related to research and development efforts on existing or potential products are expensed as incurred.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Valuation of Inventories &#8211;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Inventories are stated at the lower of cost or market, using the first-in, first-out method (FIFO) to determine cost.&#160;&#160;Our policy is to periodically evaluate the market value of the inventory and the stage of product life cycle, and record a reserve for any inventory considered slow moving or obsolete.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;For example, each additional 1% of obsolete inventory would reduce such inventory by approximately $36,000.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Allowance for doubtful accounts &#8211;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Our policy is to review our accounts receivable on a periodic basis, no less than monthly.&#160;&#160;On a quarterly basis an analysis is made of the adequacy of our allowance for doubtful accounts and adjustments are made accordingly.&#160;&#160;&#160;The current allowance is approximately 2% of accounts receivable.&#160;&#160;For example each additional 1% of accounts receivable that becomes uncollectible would reduce such balance of accounts receivable by approximately $24,000.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Income Taxes &#8211;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Income taxes are accounted for under ASC 740 authoritative guidance ("Guidance") which requires the asset and liability method of accounting for deferred income taxes.&#160;&#160;Deferred tax assets and liabilities are determined based on the difference between the financial statement and tax bases of assets and liabilities.&#160;&#160;Deferred tax assets or liabilities at the end of each period are determined using the tax rate expected to be in effect when taxes are actually paid or recovered.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Guidance also requires that a valuation allowance be established when it is more likely than not that all or a portion of a deferred tax asset will not be realized.&#160; A review of all available positive and negative evidence needs to be considered, including a company's current and past performance, the market environment in which the company operates, length of carryback and carryforward periods and existing contracts that will result in future profits.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that it will be able to utilize its net operating loss carryforwards and has recorded a deferred tax asset. The Company still maintains a full valuation allowance on research and development tax credits.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Guidance also prescribes a comprehensive model for recognizing, measuring, presenting and disclosing in the consolidated financial statements tax positions taken or expected to be taken on a tax return, including a decision whether to file or not to file in a particular jurisdiction.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The above listing is not intended to be a comprehensive list of all of our accounting policies.&#160;&#160;In many cases, the accounting treatment of a particular transaction is specifically dictated by accounting principles, generally accepted in the United States of America, with no need for management's judgment in their application.&#160;&#160;There are also areas in which management's judgment in selecting any viable alternative would not produce a materially different result.&#160;&#160;See our audited financial statements and notes thereto which contain accounting policies and other disclosures required by accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">

<EFX_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="D22846509CE84E39A5207D28BCA09789" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="EA4B9AA91CA84D8892A8C6DEE758CDFF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 72PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	ITEM 9A.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Disclosure Controls and Procedures.&#160;&#160;Under the supervision and with the participation of our senior management, consisting of our chief executive officer and our chief financial officer, we conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of the design and operation of our disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), as of the end of the period covered by this report (the "Evaluation Date").&#160;&#160;Based on that evaluation, the Company's management, including our chief executive officer and chief financial officer, concluded that as of the Evaluation Date our disclosure controls and procedures were effective to ensure that information required to be disclosed by us in the reports that we file under the Exchange Act is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified in SEC rules and forms.&#160;&#160;Our disclosure controls and procedures include, without limitation, controls and procedures designed to ensure that information required to be disclosed by us in our Exchange Act reports is accumulated and communicated to our management, including our chief executive officer and chief financial officer, as appropriate to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Management's Annual Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting.&#160;&#160;The Company's management is responsible for establishing and maintaining an adequate system of internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rule 13a-15(f)).&#160;&#160;Our internal control over financial reporting is a process, under the supervision of our chief executive officer and chief financial officer, designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States.&#160;&#160;These internal controls over financial reporting processes include policies and procedures that:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE ID="676FB5FB600448CC82AFC8B7AAE53036" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Pertain to the maintenance of records that in reasonable detail accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the Company;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE ID="AD1D9EB941114553A9689DB7FFBAA4DB" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the Company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the Company; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TABLE ID="4E5C96993C6F4609998D3E35AB5F5EAA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use or disposition of the Company's assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements.&#160;&#160;Therefore, even those systems determined to be effective can provide only reasonable assurance of achieving their control objectives.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In evaluating the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting, our management used the criteria set forth by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) in Internal Control - Integrated Framework 2013.&#160;&#160;Based on this evaluation, our Chief Executive Officer and our Chief Financial Officer concluded that our internal control over financial reporting was effective as of December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	This annual report does not include an attestation report of our registered public accounting firm regarding internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Management's report was not subject to attestation by our registered public accounting firm pursuant to the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission that permit the Company to provide only management's report in this annual report.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Changes in Internal Control over Financial Reporting.&#160;&#160;There were no changes in our internal control over financial reporting identified in connection with the evaluation required by paragraph (d) of Rule 13a-15 or Rule 15d-15 under the Exchange Act that occurred during the Company's last fiscal quarter of the period covered by this report that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
